result.title: MindCoding 3rd Round 2017
result.content:
Hello, dear friends

The third MindCoding round of 2017's edition is coming, it will take place on Thursday, April 6th . We are currently making every effort for this edition to be a successfull one and you are welcome to join our community. MindCoding is a high-performing international coding competition, structured in 4 online rounds & 1 final stage, that'll take place in Cluj-Napoca, Romania, between 28th-30th of April 2017. The third round will last 90 minutes and the contest has the same structure as the first and second rounds, consisting of 4 problems of scores ranging between 100 and 1000 which will decrease in time. We remind you that the total score to be counted towards qualification in the final round will be computed as the sum of each participant's score in all the 1st division rounds they competed in. You can also participate for fun and discovering new challenges, although this year's prizes are very generous and you still have great chances to win them (even if you have not participated during the first two qualification rounds). Here are the prizes our sponsors provided us with for this year's edition.

Our team is doing its best to turn this year's MindCoding edition into a successful one: ****

Cosmin Rusu (cr.rusucosmin) — project coordinator

Sergiu Pușcaș (Sergiu)

Marius Gavrilescu (mgv) — the creator of our platform

Gabriel Ineluș (gabrielinelus)

Bianca Costin (o_mic)

Casian Marc (marccasiannicolae)

Alexandru Ionita (juve45)

Camelia Hanes (gcatdrey)

Bereczki Norbert (bnorbertcristian)

George Linut (Browser007)

Alexandru Vasiu (alex.vasiu)

More details about the time and date of the contest in your region can be found on our online platform (https://mindcoding.ro/) , where you will also find the timeline for the next rounds. P.S.: We encourage you to warm up and practice some problems which you can find on the same page, get familiar with the environment, bring up your passion for algorithms. Moreover, don't forget to create an account if you haven't done that yet, to avoid the rush of registering right before the contest starts. Find us on our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/mindcodingcluj/ feel free to contact us and join our community. We wish you the best of luck and a high score! See you at the finals!
